description: From French appréciable; surface analysis, appreci(ate) +‎ -able.

adjectives.description: appreciable (comparative more appreciable, superlative most appreciable)

entries.meaning: (usually) Both detectable and at least modestly substantial: large enough to be estimated and to be of practical relevance.
examples: For many people, the benefits of exercise in improving mood and preventing achiness are appreciable.
A small hernia was just barely appreciable upon palpation.
